definition: to agree on three laws (idiom)/three-point covenant/(fig.) preliminary agreement/basic rules
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: You can do this by making rules with your friends that you will only speak English.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和你的朋友约法三章，你们只许讲英语。

sentences.english: You can do this by rules with your friends that you will only speak English.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和你的朋友约法三章，你们只许讲英语。

sentences.english: I set some ground rules, trying to be clear and reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 我跟她约法三章，尽量清晰合理。

sentences.english: Since I don't have the time to properly train you, I'm laying down three simple rules.
sentences.chinese: 因为我没有时间去训练你们，所以我在这约法三章。

sentences.english: Marriage that night, cheng bite gold to draw up three chapters.
sentences.chinese: 婚事当晚，程咬金欲约法三章。

sentences.english: Lily, Ted is our best friend, let's get something straight.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉，特德是我们最好的朋友，我们先约法三章。

definition: to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
